discourse_list.title: Judge Rejects Musk's Attempt to Terminate Settlement Agreement with the SEC

content.content: I have been doing some reading and came across the below cited article that discusses Elon Musk’s recent attempt to terminate a consent decree regarding his settlement with the SEC over Tesla related tweets. I find this interesting on a few levels but particularly intriguing considering the recent events. I think he used the “funding secured” language recently as to the purchase of Twitter if I’m not mistaken but things are different now. In any event, this is fun to watch!    TechCrunch    Elon Musk loses fight to end SEC settlement over Tesla tweets – TechCrunch Elon Musk’s attempt to terminate a 2018 settlement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission that requires oversight of some of his Tesla-related tweets has failed. U.S. District Judge Lewis Liman denied Wednesday a motion made by Musk’s...

I remember the 420 tesla hahaha. Remember that twitter is pure blabla and little action. Elon promises a lot of things. But the current ceo and his employees will do everything possible to stay in the company.
and as a curious fact 54.20 I buy twitter shares.
